page.title: 04Tipton Wildlife
page.content: Although Tipton is industrial in character it has many animals.There are many types of birds of which the sparrow is probably the most common.The starling is also common.They flourish everywhere feeding on seeds and scraps.Some not very familiar birds are found like the magpie I have seen near Robert Road.Kestrels can also be seen around the area especially by the old railway and above the grass verges.Swifts and swallows are found but they don't stay very long. Foxes can be found around Tipton,usually on the Recreation Ground by the old railway.There even used to be foxes at Tipton Station.Mice and bats are common especially in old buildings.Water rats can be found by the canal.
